about_the_game:
You are trapped in a Hotel by accident

Check the list of how to deal with abnormal symptoms around the starting point

Escape by going down to the first floor while carefully observing your surroundings

Find out all the signs of abnormality in the hallway

If abnormalities are found, you can move on after solving them through coping with abnormalities.

If you don't find any abnormalities, you can just move on.

Ninth Hotel is an escape simulator inspired by the Neapolitan horror stories

There are no signs of abnormality on the ninth floors.

Please check out this ninth floor in detail.

From the eighth floor, there are various types of abnormalities.

From easily identifiable anomalies to those that need to be closely watched, don't let your guard down

Please go down to the first floor safely and escape while checking and avoiding abnormalities within the given time.

If you don't escape within the given time, the scariest fear will hit you.

[the way of playing]

moving: WASD

Jump: Shift

Flash: right-click

* Warning *

Flash usage time is limited. Use only when necessary

[Playtime]

15 to 30 minutes

The setting options provide graphics, sound-related adjustment options

The game will be available in English, Korean, Japanese

(Korean language support to be provided)

name: Ninth Hotel

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Window 10, 11
  • Processor: inter Core i7 4770
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX970
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 1 GB available space
